item.title: Integrating with VMware NSX
Integrating Hardware VTEPs with Midokura MidoNet and OpenStack
Static MAC Bindings with VXLAN
item.description: Cumulus Linux includes native Linux VXLAN kernel support. Requirements A VXLAN configuration requires a switch with a Tomahawk, Trident II+ or Trident II chipset running Cumulus Linux 2.0 or later. For a basic VXLAN configuration, you should ensure that: The VXLAN has a network identifier (VNI); do not use 0 or 16777215 as the VNI ID, as they are reserved values under Cumulus Linux. The VXLAN link and local interfaces are added to bridge to create the association between port, VLAN and VXLAN instance.
